name: Observation result status codes interpretation
description: Status codes indicating the state and reliability of laboratory and clinical observation results

values.description: Record coming over is a correction and thus replaces a final result
values.definition: Corrected result that supersedes previously reported final results
Instruction to remove the observation record from the system

values.description: Final results; Can only be changed with a corrected result.
values.definition: Definitive results that have been verified and released for clinical use
Specimen has been received and is being processed, results not yet available

values.description: Not asked; used to affirmatively document that the observation identified in the OBX was not sought when the universal service ID in OBR-4 implies that it would be sought.
values.definition: Explicitly indicates that this observation was not requested despite being part of the ordered service
Provides order information without accompanying result values
Initial results subject to change upon further verification or analysis
Results have been entered into the system but have not undergone verification process

values.description: Partial results.   Deprecated. Retained only for backward compatibility as of V2.6.
values.definition: Incomplete results, deprecated status maintained for system compatibility

values.description: Results status change to final without retransmitting results already sent as 'preliminary.'  E.g., radiology changes status from preliminary to final
values.definition: Status update from preliminary to final without resending the actual result values

values.description: Post original as wrong, e.g., transmitted for wrong patient
values.definition: Indicates that the originally transmitted result was posted in error

values.description: Results cannot be obtained for this observation
values.definition: Unable to perform or complete the requested observation due to technical or clinical constraints

notes: Critical for result lifecycle management and ensuring appropriate clinical interpretation of observation status
